page.title: 20LIVISTER YOUTH CENTRE
page.content: The old school at {Livister}was made into a youth centre in 1964.This was after Symbister House was repaired and made into the school for the island. The youth centre is at present open on Wednesday,Thursday and Friday evenings and is open to young people on the isle aged 9 and over. It costs about Â£2000 a year to run, some of this money coming from the council,the rest from members and fund raising. Facilities at the Youth Centre include 2 Pool Tables,Dart boards, Table Tennis, television,computer games, juke box, table football and a cafe which sells sweets,crisps and soft drinks. There are pool competitions held and films shown.On occasions teams compete against other Shetland Youth Club teams at netball,football etc.
